definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: A new measurement method for nutation angle has been put forward.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種新的測量彈丸攻角的方法。

sentences.english: When the projectile Fei Da hit angle is big, the shell explodes the fragment can disperse evenly.
sentences.chinese: 當彈丸飛達命中角度大，炮彈爆炸的碎片能均勻飛散。

sentences.english: The projectiles are stabilized using a hydrodynamic cavity, generated by the flat point of the projectile.
sentences.chinese: 這種炮彈是利用流體動力學穩定腔，由彈丸小點生成。

sentences.english: A "bolus like" injection was conducted to administrate the contrast agent into left forearm veins.
sentences.chinese: 聲學造影劑經左前臂靜脈“彈丸式”注射。

sentences.english: The patterns for a projectile traveling in the ideal increasing twist bore are studied.
sentences.chinese: 求解了非對稱彈丸在漸速膛線理想身管內的運動規律。

sentences.english: Jack was given a solid-projectile submachinegun that fired explosive pellets.
sentences.chinese: 傑克配備了一支發射可爆彈丸的霰彈衝鋒槍。

sentences.english: A "bolus-like" injection was conducted to administrate the contrast agent into left forearm veins.
sentences.chinese: 聲學造影劑經左前臂淺靜脈“彈丸式”注射。

sentences.english: Tiny Qatar is just one of the examples.
sentences.chinese: 彈丸之地卡塔爾就是一個例子。

sentences.english: Odds are much better that a little nut-job country like NK would use them.
sentences.chinese: 像北朝鮮這種彈丸小國使用核武器的話，成本小多了。

sentences.english: Relationship between rotation and translation of the projectile is determined by the pitch of the rifling.
sentences.chinese: 彈丸可有偏心，其轉動和平動的關係由膛線纏角確定。

sentences.english: Despite its small size, the territory has a unique ecological environment.
sentences.chinese: 香港雖只是彈丸之地，但有着獨特的生態環境。

sentences.english: Like the heavy turrets, these cannons fire high density projectiles electromagnetically.
sentences.chinese: 像沉重的塔樓，這些大炮射擊高密度彈丸電磁。

sentences.english: The dough is twisted into a rope-like strip and pelletized into small lumps.
sentences.chinese: 將面搓成條，掐成彈丸狀小塊。

sentences.english: The developer was infused via elbow vein in a pellet manner, and dynamic collection was performed immediately.
sentences.chinese: 顯像劑以肘靜脈“彈丸式”注入，即刻進行動態採集。

sentences.english: Despite being only a small place, Hong Kong is the home of more than seven million people.
sentences.chinese: 香港雖爲彈丸之地，但卻是七百多萬市民的安居之所。

sentences.english: To some extent, this is a challenge endemic to tiny places like Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，這是香港這類彈丸之地的死穴。

definition: to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
Iron Curtain (1945-1991) (in Taiwan, 鐵幕 was used to refer to both the Iron Curtain and the Bamboo Curtain)
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
